TopicTitle: OF-7 Orbital Eagle SSTO (MechJeb, B9, FAR)

Articles.Content:
Warning: Lots of pics.

A heavy SSTO fighter that looks just vaguely like an F-15 Eagle, if you squint a bit. Carries 6 Javelin missiles (all stock), fired in 3 volleys by staging. Plane has retro-rockets for final deceleration and parachutes, because a conventional landing off-runway is best not attempted (I certainly haven't succeeded, but I'm a pretty terrible pilot).

Action groups:

1: Toggle turbojets

2: Toggle RAPIER mode

3: Toggle intakes

4: Toggle RAPIER engines

[5 deliberately left empty]

6: Small airbrakes

7: Large airbrakes

[8 deliberately left empty]

9: Ladders

0: Docking port and illuminator

Flight profile:

Stage and lift off. AoA of 45 degrees until 10km, then reduce rate of climb to <100m/s and accelerate. At some point the turbojets will lose thrust; when turbojet thrust reaches nil, turn them off and continue on RAPIERs. (Because I'm lazy, I use MechJeb to prevent flameouts.) You should be able to get to about 29-30km before switching RAPIER modes and closing the intakes; after that point the nose to 45 degrees and throttle down to conserve fuel. Get Ap to about 75km, then circularise.
